alert.note: Alert for Adair; Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 15 at 7:49PM CST until December 16 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR ADAIR...CHARITON...RANDOLPH...SOUTHEASTERN LINN...EAST CENTRAL CARROLL...SCHUYLER...NORTH CENTRAL SALINE AND MACON COUNTIES... At 746 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Bloomfield to 6 miles north of Novinger to 8 miles north of Bucklin to 11 miles southwest of Marceline, moving northeast at 85 mph. Law enforcement reported 85 mph winds with several roofs blown off in the town of Unionville when the storms moved through. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR PARTS OF NORTHERN AND NORTHEASTERN MISSOURI. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Kirksville, Moberly, Macon, Marceline, Salisbury, Huntsville, La Plata, Lancaster, Brunswick, Bevier, Queen City, Keytesville, Bucklin, Novinger, Greentop, Atlanta, Downing, Callao, Cairo and Brashear. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across the warned area. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
